Content: I don't know if this is the right spot for PC technical help

Author: Ratchet
Content: long story short about a week and a half ago I got a "memory management" error

Author: Ratchet
Content: spent about 2 hours trying to do all kinds of tests

Author: Ratchet
Content: trying to find something

Author: Ratchet
Content: and I found corrupted files that my PC managed to fix by itself I guess.

Author: Ratchet
Content: I don't remember the exact things I used but I can dig it out and find it if anyone is curious

Author: Ratchet
Content: I assumed this fixed the problem. The computer worked normally for about 4 days and that day I decided to shut the computer off and take it downstairs for cleaning because I figured it was due for a cleaning. Long story short as the computer was shutting down (literally mid shutdown) I got the error again.

Author: Ratchet
Content: After I got it I went through all the same tests I did earlier and found nothing.

Author: Ratchet
Content: went to the event viewer and found a critical 41 kernal power error

Author: Ratchet
Content: it's been about a week since this happened but I've been afraid to do anything on this PC out of fear that it'll happen again. I've tried to replicate things somewhat but it hasn't happened next.

Author: Ratchet
Content: the only intensive thing I was doing during that entire week was emulating a SNES game. CPU/GPU temps were normal things seemed fine.

Author: Ratchet
Content: I'm just unsure if it was an insolated incident

Author: Ratchet
Content: or if my power supply is going to shit

Author: Bernas
Content: error 41 is just windows saying it didnt shut down properly

Author: Bernas
Content: make a usb drive with memtest86 and test your ram sticks overnight

Author: Bernas
Content: ideally do them one at a time for 2-3 passes eacg

Author: Bernas
Content: each

Author: Ratchet
Content: gotcha

Author: Ratchet
Content: so the memory management error is what I should really be worrying about

Author: Ratchet

Author: Bernas
Content: ye error 41 is windows saying hey dude you didnt hit the shutdown button

Author: Bernas
Content: iirc

Content: gotcha

Author: Ratchet
Content: well I did most of the ram related testing that I can do via windows 10 so I assumed it's fine

Author: Ratchet

Author: Bernas
Content: memtest is the safest bet_ especially doing one at a time. could also be a OS thing in which case a clean wipe should fix it
